277349.「このギルドの者だな？\n お前に 聞きたいことがある。\n つつみ隠さず 神妙:
You are from this guild, aren't you? I have a
question for you. Don't hide it, but answer
mysteriously.

277350.「は？ なんだい あんたは。\n 突然 やって来て ずいぶんと\n ぶしつけじゃ:
Huh? What's the matter with you? You came all
of a sudden, and you're so impolite, aren't
you?

277351.「……私は ヴェリナード王国から\n 派遣された 魔法戦士のゲーダムという。\n:
My name is Gedam, an armamentalist sent by the
Verinard Kingdom. I'm looking for information
on a certain group of pirates.

277352.「なら 最初から そう言やいいんだ。\n それで 海賊団が どうしたって？:
Then just say so from the beginning. So,
what's up with the pirates?

277353.「ここでは 船に使う木材を扱っているだろう。\n 海賊が 客として 来ることはな:
They will be dealing in lumber for ships. Do
pirates ever come here as customers?

277354.「ああ そう言えば この前\n ハル……なんたらって 海賊団のヤツが\n 木材を:
Oh, by the way, the other day a group of
pirates called Hal...whatever...came in
looking for lumber.

277355.「ハルバルド海賊団だなっ！？\n 奴らと 取り引きをしたのか？\n アジトの場所:
Halbard Pirates! You made a deal with them? Do
you know where their hideout is?

277356.「そっ そんなの知らねえよ！\n あいつら 態度 悪かったからな。\n 話も聞か:
I don't know anything about that! They were so
rude. I didn't even listen to what they had to
say, so I kicked them out.

277358.「もしや お前も 海賊か？\n かすかに 海と火薬のニオイがする……。:
Are you a pirate, too? I can faintly smell the
sea and gunpowder.

277359.「このヒトは マドロック海賊団のヒトだよ。\n 前に来た連中と違って コシが低か:
This person is from the Madlock Pirates. Unlike the others who came before, he had a low profile. I was listening to what they had
to say.

277361.「私が 追っているのは ハルバルド海賊団だ。\n お前らは 後回しにしてやる。:
I am after the Halbard Pirates. You will come
later.

277362.「海賊団など どこも 似たようなクズの集団だ。\n 私につぶされる前に 足を洗っ:
Pirate gangs are all the same kind of scum.
You'd better wash your feet before I crush
you.

277363.「お前なら 海賊などにならずとも\n もっと マシな職に つけるだろう。:
You don't have to be a pirate to get a better
job.

277364.「なんだ あいつ……。\n 聞くだけ聞いて 礼もナシかよ。:
What's with that guy... He just asks and
doesn't thank me?

277365.「ああ あんたとの話が 途中だったな。\n 悪いが 仕切り直そう。\n もう一度:
Ah, I'm in the middle of a conversation with
you. I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to
finish. Can you talk to me one more time?
